lines.text:
[dressed as the ticket-taker]
Tickets please.

[in German]
What?
[Indiana punches him, picks him up and throws him out a window into a pile of luggage; the other passengers look at him, bewildered]

[pointing out the window at Vogel]
No ticket.
[the other passengers all pull out their tickets and wave them furiously at him]
Please, what does it always mean, this... this "Junior"?
That's his name.
[points to himself]
Henry Jones...
[points to Indy]
...Junior.
I like "Indiana."
We named the *dog* Indiana.
May we go home now, please?
The dog?
[starts laughing]
You are named after the dog? HA HA HA...!
I've got a lot of fond memories of that dog.
You lost today, kid. But that doesn't mean you have to like it.
Nazis. I hate these guys.
Sallah, I said *no* camels. That's *five* camels. Can't you count?
He chose... poorly.
[Lecturing in class]

Archeology is the search for fact, not truth. If it's truth you're interested in, Dr. Tyree's Philosophy class is right down the hall. So forget any ideas you've got about lost cities, exotic travel, and digging up the world. We do not follow maps to buried treasure, and "X" never, ever marks the spot.
[Encountering a painting of the Ark of the Covenant]
What's this?
Ark of the Covenant.
Are you sure?
Pretty sure.
The Word of God.
No, Henry. Try not to talk.
The Name of God.
The Name of God... Jehovah.
But in the Latin alphabet, "Jehovah" begins with an "I".
[he steps on the "J" and almost falls to his death; he scrambles back up]
Oh, *idiot*! In Latin Jehovah begins with an "I"!
[Nazi Colonel Vogel is torturing Henry to get answers]
Tell me about this miserable little diary of yours. The book is useless and yet you come all the way back to Berlin to get it. Why?
[he slaps Henry in the face with his glove]
Why?
[he slaps him again]
What are you hiding?
[he slaps him again]
What does the diary tell you that it doesn't tell us?
[he tries to slap him again; Henry grabs his wrist, stopping him]

[through his teeth]
It tells me, that goose-stepping morons like yourself should try *reading* books instead of *burning* them!
[talking about how they both slept with the same woman]
It's disgraceful, you're old enough to be her... her grandfather.
Well, I'm as human as the next man.
Dad, I *was* the next man.
Oh... ships that pass in the night.
Water?
No thank you, sir, no. Fish make love in it.
I'm like a bad penny, I always turn up.

[of Indy's new lover]
How did you know she was a Nazi?
She talks in her sleep.
[Indiana and Henry are tied up]
Come on, dad. Help me get us out of here. We have to get to Marcus before the Nazis do.
But you said he had a two day head start. That he would blend in, disappear.
Are you kidding? I made all that up. You know Marcus. He once got lost in his own museum.

[to Indy]
I'll never forget how vonderful it vas.
Why thank you. It was rather wonderful.

[kisses Indy]
Zat's how Austrians say goodbye.
Und zis is how ve zay goodbye in Germany, Dr. Jones.
[punches Indy with the head of his cane; Indy's head smacks into Henry's behind him]
I liked the Austrian way better.
So did I.
It's perfectly obvious where the pages are. He's given them to Marcus Brody.
Marcus? You didn't drag poor Marcus along did you? He's not up to the challenge.
He sticks out like a sore thumb. We'll find him.

The hell you will. He's got a two day head start on you, which is more than he needs. Brody's got friends in every town and village from here to the Sudan, he speaks a dozen languages, knows every local custom, he'll blend in, disappear, you'll never see him again. With any luck, he's got the grail already.
[Cut to middle of fair in the Middle East, Marcus Brody wearing bright suit and white hat, sticking out like sore thumb]
Uhhh, does anyone here speak English?
I suddenly remembered my Charlemagne. Let my armies be the rocks and the trees and the birds in the sky...
[after commandeering a plane]
I didn't know you could fly a plane.
Fly, yes. Land, no.
I've got to tell you something.
Don't get sentimental now, dad. Save it 'til we get out of here.
The floor's on fire, see? AND the chair.
[Vogel is holding Elsa hostage at gunpoint]
Throw down the gun or the girl will die.
But she's one of them.
Indy, please!
She's a Nazi.
What?
Trust me.
Indy, help!
I will kill her!
Oh yeah? Go ahead.
No! Don't shoot!
Don't worry. He won't.
Indy, please do what he says!
And don't listen to her.
Enough! She dies!
Wait! Wait.
[Indy tosses over the gun. Vogel lets Elsa go and she runs right into Indy's arms]
I'm sorry.
Don't be.
[Elsa takes the grail diary from Indy's pocket, smiles, then hands it to Vogel]
But you should have listened to your father.
Is there anyone here who speaks English? Or maybe even ancient Greek?
Don't look at me like that. We both wanted the Grail. I would have done anything to get it. You would have done the same.
I'm sorry you think so.
I can remeber the last time we had a drink together. I had a milkshake. but, we didn't talk, we've never talked. Only if you were a regular dad just like the other boy's dad, this would be different.
I was a wonderful father.
Yeah, how?
Did I ever tell you to eat up, go to bed, wash your ears, do your homework? No, I respected your privacy and I taught you self reliance.

What you taught me, is that I was less important to you than people that have been dead for several hundered years and in other countries, and I learned it so well, that we've hardly spoken for 20 years.
You left, just as you were becoming interesting.
[Closes his diary]
Okay, I 'm here what you wanna talk about?

[At a lost for words]
I... I don't know.
Only in a leap from the lion's head shall he prove his worth.
Archaeology is the search for fact... not truth. If it's truth you're looking for, Dr. Tyree's philosophy class is right down the hall.
Elsa never really believed in the grail. She thought she'd found a prize.
And what did you find, Dad?
Me? Illumination.

[to his father]
I was just remembering the last time we had a quiet drink together. I had a milkshake.

[an explosion destroyed the car that Indy, Sallah and Dr. Jones arrived in]
That car was my brother-in-law's.
[Indiana Jones and Professor Jones Sr. are trapped between a room on fire and a room full of Nazis]
Our situation has not improved.
[accidentally shoots their own plane with the machine gun]
Dad, are we hit?
More or less. Son, I'm sorry. They got us.
[Indiana slips and nearly falls into the abyss, but Henry grabs his hand]
Junior, give me your other hand! I can't hold on!

[reaching for the Grail]
I can get it. I can almost reach it, Dad...
Indiana.
[surprised, Indy looks up at his father]
Indiana... let it go.
The quest for the grail is not archeology, it's a race against evil. If it is captured by the Nazis the armies of darkness will march all over the face of the earth. Do you understand me?
This is an obsession, Dad. I've never understood it. Never. Neither did Mom.
Oh yes she did. Only too well. Unfortunately, she kept her illness from me. All I could do was mourn her.
Rolls-Royce Phantom two. 4.3 litre, 30 horsepower, six cylinder engine, with Stromberg downdraft carburetor, can go from zero to 100 kilometres an hour in 12.5 seconds. And I even like the color.
Marcus.
Aah.
Genius of the res-to-ration.
[Brody finishes the handshake]
Aid our own re-sus-ci-tation. Henry, what are you doing here?
It's a rescue. Come on.
[the Nazis catch both Marcus and Henry]
[Indy has untied a boat as a diversion for the Nazis]
Come on, Dad! Come on!
What about the boat? We're not going on the boat?

[shouting, as the boat is being chopped up by a propeller]
Why are you trying to kill us?
Because you are looking for the Holy Grail!
My *father* was looking for the Holy Grail! Did you kill him too?
No!
Where is he? Talk or you're dead! Dammit tell me! Tell me!
If you don't let go Dr. Jones, we'll both die!
Then we'll die!
My soul is prepared! How's yours?

[as the room is burning]
Dad!
What?
Dad!
What?
DAD!
WHAT?
Dad, head for the fireplace!
[Indiana Jones walks over after climbing up from the cliff and Professor Henry Jones grabs him in hug]
I thought I'd lost you boy.
I thought you had too Sir.

[moves back and attempts to compose himself]
Well... well done. Come on.
[Professor Henry Jones walks away and Indiana Jones collapses to the ground in exhaustion]

[looks back and frowns]
Why are you sitting there resting when we're so near the end?
Those people are trying to kill us!

[shouts]
I know, Dad!
This is a new experience for me.
It happens to me all the time.
I'm sorry about your head though. But I thought that you were one of them.
Dad, they come in through the doors.
Ha, good point.
[to Indiana, while watching a Nazi parade and book burning]
My son, we're pilgrims in an unholy land.
But choose wisely, for while the true Grail will bring you life, the false Grail will take it from you.
If you're a Scottish Lord, then I am Mickey Mouse.
How dare he.

[after having taken five camels formerly belonging to hired troops working for the Nazis]
Compensation for my brother-in-law's car!
And in this sort of race, there's no silver medal for finishing second.

[Answering door]
Yes?

[In Scottish accent]
Not before time! did you intend to leave us standing on the doorstep all day? we're drenched
[sneezes in butler's face]
Now look, I've gone and caught a sniffle
Are you expected?
Don't take that tone with me my good man! Now buttle off and tell Baron Brunwald that Lord Clarence McDonald and his lovely assistant
[Drags Elsa towards him]
are here to view the tapestries
Tapestries?
The old man is dense, this is a castle isn't it? there are tapestries
This is a castle and we have many tapestries, and if you are a Scottish lord then I am Mickey Mouse!
How dare he?
[punches butler in face]

...who drinks the water I shall give him, says the Lord, will have a spring inside him welling up for eternal life. Let them bring me to your holy mountain in the place where you dwell. Across the desert and through the mountain to the Canyon of the Crescent Moon, to the Temple where the cup that - where the cup that holds the blood of Jesus Christ resides forever.

[to Indy]
Ask yourself, why do you seek the Cup of Christ? Is it for His glory, or for yours?

[the Nazis burst into the room]
Dr. Jones?
Yes?
I will take zuh book now.
Wuh-what b-book?
You have zuh diary in your pocket.
You dolt! You think my son would be that stupid? That he would bring my diary all the way back here?
[pause]
You didn't, did you?
[another pause]
You didn't bring it, did you?
Well, uh...
You *did*!
Look, can we discuss this later?
I should have mailed it to the Marx Brothers!
Will you take it easy?
Take it easy? Why do you think I sent it home in the first place? So it wouldn't fall into their hands!
I came here to SAVE you!
Oh, yeah? And who's gonna come to save you, JUNIOR?

[shouts]
I told you...
[grabs a gun and shoots all soldiers dead]
DON'T call me Junior!
Look what you did! I can't believe what you did!
Small world, Dr. Jones.
Too small for two of us.
This is the second time I've had to reclaim my property from you.
That belongs in a museum.
So do you.
[last lines]
Indy, Henry, follow me. I know the way. Ha!
[Marcus' horse rides off with him barely hanging onto it]
Got lost in his own museum, eh?
Uh-huh.
After you, Junior.
Yes, sir. Ha!

[Examining the broken vase]
Late 14th Ming Dynasty. Oh it breaks the heart.
And the head. You hit me dad.
I'll never forgive myself.
Don't worry I'm all right.
Thank God... it's fake. See you can tell with the cross sections.
the Grail cannot pass beyond the Great Seal, for that is the boundry, and the price, of immortality.
You came back for the book? Why?
My father didn't want it incinerated.

[angrily]
Is that what you think of me? I believe in the Grail, not the Swastika!

[angrily]
You stood up to be counted with the enemies of everything the Grail stands for! Who gives a *damn* what you believe?

[pleadingly]
You do!
Are you crazy? Don't go between them!
Go between them! Are you crazy?

[grabbing Elsa by the throat]
All I have to do is squeeze.
All I have to do is scream.
Jesus Christ...

[slaps him]
That's for blasphemy.
I find, that if I just sit down to think...
[sits in chair, which tilts backward and opens up a hidden staircase]

[falling down hidden staircase]
Daaaaad!

[resetting chair legs]
The solution presents itself!

[steals a flower for Elsa]
Fraulein, will you permit me?
I usually don't.
I usually don't either.
In that case I permit you.
It would make me very happy.
But I am already sad, by tomorrow it will have faded.
Tomorrow I'll steal you another one.
Dr. Jones?
Yes?
I knew it was you, you have your father's eyes.
And my mother's ears but the rest belongs to you.
It looks like the best parts have already been spoken for.

[Looking through his binoculars and seeing a tank]
12 pound gun.
What are you doing? Get down.
Dad, we're well out of range.
[the tanks fires on them]
[Donovan wants Indy to get the Grail]
You could go down in history.
As what? A Nazi stooge like you?

The Nazis? Is that the limit of your vision? The Nazis want to write themselves into the Grail legend, take on the world. Well, they're welcome to it. But I want the Grail itself, the cup that gives everlasting life. Hitler can have the world, but he can't take it with him. I'm going to be drinking my own health after he's gone the way of the dodo.

[to Indy after a kiss]
How dare you kiss me!
[She kisses him]

[pulling away]
Leave me alone, I don't like fast women.

[biting his ear]
And I hate arrogant men.

[after finding that her room has been ransacked]
My room.
Mine too.
What were they looking for?
This.
The Grail Diary?
Uh huh.
You had it? You didn't trust me?
I didn't know you. At least I let you tag along.
Oh yes, Give them a flower and they'll follow you anywhere.
Knock it off, you're not mad.
No?
No, you like the way I do things.
You're lucky I don't do things the same way. You'd still be standing at the Venice Pier.

What do you think is going on here? Since I've met you I've nearly been incinerated, drowned, shot at and chopped into fish bait. We're caught in the middle of something sinister here. My guess is dad found out more than he was looking for and until I am sure I am going to continue to do things the way I think they should be done.
[Indiana Kisses Elsa]
How dare you kiss me.
[Elsa Kisses Indiana]
Leave me alone, I don't like fast women.

[while nibbling on Indiana's ear]
And I hate arrogant men.

[after they both fall into bed, kissing]
Ahh, Venice.
Look at this! I've gone and caught a sniffle!

[Being tied up together]
We gotta get free, dad. We've gotts get to Marcus before the Nazis do.
I thought that Marcus had a 2 day head start, and would vanish, disappear.
No. I made that up. C'mon dad, you know Marcus he got lost in one of his own museums one time. Dad, can you reach into my left pocket?
What will I find?

[Sarcastically]
A lucky charm.

[Reaches into Indy's left jacket pocket]
Feels like a cigarette lighter.
Use it to burn the ropes.
[Then Henry lights thew lighter and reaches back and burns himself androps the lighter to the floor, and after blowing on it a few times he starts a fire]
Son, there's something I have to tell you.
Don't get sentimental now dad, save until we get out.
The floor is in fire, and the chair.
Junior?
Yes, sir.
It *is* you, Junior.
Don't call me that. *Please*.

Listen. Since I've met you I've nearly been incinerated, drowned, shot at, and chopped into fish bait. We're caught in the middle of something sinister here, my guess is dad found out more than he was looking for and until I'm sure, I'm going to continue to do things the way I think they should be done.
[Finding a hidden passage in a Venetian library]
"X" marks the spot.
The search for the Grail is the search for the divine in all of us. But if you want facts, Indy, I've none to give you. At my age, I'm prepared to take a few things on faith.
[Repeated line]
Ahh, Venice.
You say this has been just another typical day for you huh?
NO. It's been better than most.
My reputation preceeds me.
There is no museum in Iskenderun.
Papers, please.

[laughing]
Papers? Of course
[to Marcus]
Run.
Yes.
Papers. Got it here. Just finished reading it myself.
[to Marcus]
Run.
Yes.
"Egyptian Mail," morning edition.
[to Marcus]
Run.
Did you say, uh...
[Sallah punches one of the German guides]
RUN!
Find the man and you'll find the Grail.
You've got the wrong Jones, Mr. Donovan. Why don't you try my father?
We already have. Your father is the man who has disappeared.
Stop. You're going the wrong way. We need to get to Berlin.
Brody's this way.
My diary's in Berlin.
We don't need the diary, Dad. Marcus has the map.
There is more in the diary than just the map.
Half the German army's on our tail and you want me to go to Berlin? Into the lion's den?
Yes. The only thing that matters is the Grail.
What about Marcus?
Marcus would agree with me!
Petroleum... I should stick a well down here and retire.
As you can now see, Dr. Jones, we are on the verge of completing a quest that began almost two thousand years ago. We're just one step away.
That's usually when the ground falls out from underneath your feet.

[points a gun at Indy]
The Grail is mine. And you're going to get it for me.
Shooting me won't get you anywhere.
You know something, Dr. Jones? You're absolutely right.
[He shoots Henry in the stomach]
Oh, rats!
[Indiana Jones finds a whole bunch of rats in his path]

[after hearing that Indy read the tablet]
If only I could have been there with you.
There were rats, Dad.

[Startled]
Rats?

[meeting Indy and Marcus in Venice]
The last time I saw your father we were in the library. He was very close to tracking down the Knight's tomb. I've never seen him so excited. He was as giddy as a schoolboy.
Who, Atilla The Professor? He was never giddy, even when he was a schoolboy.
[Elsa has helped Vogal capture Indy and his father]
She ransacked her own room, and I fell for it!
[Indy and his father have boarded the airship]
Well, we made it!

[looking out from behind his newspaper]
When we are airborne, with Germany behind us, *then* I will share that sentiment!
[Indy and his father have stolen a plane from the airship, and are now being chased by German fighters]
Dad, you're going to have to use the machine gun. Get it ready!
[Henry turns around and gets the gun ready]

[spotting an approaching fighter]
11 o'clock! Dad, 11 o'clock!

[looking at his watch]
What happens at 11 o'clock?
You got heart, kid.
[about the cross]
But that belongs to me.
It belongs to Coronado.
Coronado's dead, and so are all of his grandchildren!
This should be in a museum!
[Elsa picks up the Grail and attempts to leave the Temple with it]
We have got it, come on!
Elsa. Elsa don't move.
It's ours Indy, yours and mine.
Elsa don't cross the seal. The knight warned us not to take the grail from here!
[Elsa ignores Indiana and her bootheel steps across the Great Seal, triggering the temple's collapse]
[Elsa slips into a crevice and nearly falls, but Indiana grabs her leather gloved hands just in time. She slowly turns her head to see the grail resting below her]
Elsa...
[Elsa wrenches her left hand free to reach the grail]
Elsa. Don't Elsa. Elsa. Give me your other hand honey, I can't hold you!
I can reach it... I can reach it...
[the glove on her hand starts slipping]
Elsa. Give me your hand, give me your other hand!
[Elsa cries out as she nearly touches the grail. The glove suddenly slips off her hand and she plunges into the abyss]
Elsa!
Bingo!
You don't disappoint, Dr. Jones. You're a great deal like your father.
Except he's lost and I'm not.

[after escaping from the Nazis, and coming onto a road sign]
Stop, wait, stop! Stop! You're going the wrong way. We have to get to Berlin.

[Points to the sign]
Brody's *this* way.
My diary's in Berlin.

[cross]
We don't need the diary, dad; Marcus has the map.
There is more in the diary than *just the map*.

[stops the motorcycle, annoyed]
All right, Dad. Tell me.
Well, he who finds the Grail must face the final challenge.
What final challenge?
Three devices of such lethal cunning.
Booby traps?
Oh, yes. But I found the clues that will safely take us through them in the Chronicles of St. Anselm.

[pleased]
Well, what are they?
[annoyed]
Can't you remember?
I wrote them down in my diary so that I wouldn't *have* to remember.

[angry]
Half the German Army's on our tail and you want me to go to Berlin? Into the lion's den?
Yes! The only thing that matters is the Grail.
What about Marcus?
Marcus would agree with me!

[quietly]
Two selfless martyrs; Jesus Christ.

[slaps Indy, angrily]
That was for blasphemy! The quest for the Grail is not archaeology; it's a race against evil! If it is captured by the Nazis, the armies of darkness will march all over the face of the Earth! Do you understand me?

[Still annoyed]
This is an obsession, dad. I *never* understood it. Never. Neither did mom.
Oh, yes she did. Just all too well. But, she kept her illness from me. All I could do was mourn her.
Nice landing.
Thank you.
[Indy bursts through the window into his father's room. He's hit on the head with a vase]
Junior!

[reflexively]
Yes, sir!
It IS you, Junior!
Don't call me that, please!

[gesturing to a window where he just threw out a Nazi Officer]
No ticket.
It was just the two of us, dad. It was a lonely way to grow up. For you, too. If you had been an ordinary, average father like the other guys' dads, you'd have understood that.
Actually, I was a wonderful father.
When?
Did I ever tell you to eat up? Go to bed? Wash your ears? Do your homework? No. I respected your privacy and I taught you self- reliance.
What you taught me was that I was less important to you than people who had been dead for five hundred years in another country. And I learned it so well that we've hardly spoken for twenty years.
You left just when you were becoming interesting.
I believe in the Grail, not the Swastika.
You stood up to be counted with the enemies of everything the Grail stands for. Who gives a damn what you believe?
You do.
Oh, Jesus Christ!
[Professor Jones Senior slaps him]

[after blasting a truck off of the tank]
Where is Jones?
You call *this* archaeology?
Germany has declared war on the Jones boys.
[Henry, struggling with a Nazi for a gun, uses his fountain pen to blind the Nazi]
Henry, the pen.
What?
Well don't you see? The pen is mightier than the sword.
Well, Marcus, we're on the verge of the greatest discovery in the history of mankind.
And you're meddling with powers you can't possibly comprehend.
[Vogel has captured Henry]
Colonel. Jones is getting away.
I think not, Herr Donovan.
Not THAT Jones, the OTHER Jones.

[to Indy]
Well, I didn't trust her. Why did you?
Because he didn't take my advice. Didn't I tell you not to trust anyone, Dr. Jones?
I misjudged you, Walter. I knew you would sell your mother for an Etruscan vase. But I didn't know you would sell out your country and your soul... to the slime of humanity.

[to a street vendor]
No thank you ma'am, I'm a vegetarian.

[in dismay]
Does anyone understand a word I'm saying here?
Care to wet your whistle Marcus?
I'd rather spit in your face. But as I haven't got any spit...
[takes the flasks, but it is grabbed by Vogel before he can take a sip]
[first lines]
Dismount!

[on top of a moving army tank with Indiana]
How does one get off this thing?
[Indy accidentally hits him with his elbow as he pulls back for a punch; Marcus falls off the tank]
[repeated line]
This is intolerable!
What are you gonna do?
I dont know, but i'll think of something!
Dig with your hands, not with your mouth.
I trust your trip down was comfortable, Dr Jones. My men didn't alarm you, I hope.
Enjoy this Mr. Brody. You're about to witness the best discoveries in the history of mankind.
You're meddling with powers you can't possibly comprehend.

[bursts into his father's study]
Dad...!
Out.
I have to show you something!
It can wait. Count to twenty.
No, Dad, I-!
Junior!
One, two, three, f...
In Greek.

[rolls his eyes]
Ana, theo, thea...
[Henry Jones has just disarmed a Nazi soldier by squirting ink in his face from his fountain pen]

[meaningfully]
Henry... the pen.
What?
Don't you see? The *pen* is mightier than the sword!
[Brody smiles goofily yet happily]
